intro: Crepis abietina, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring rocky and well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a rosette, helping to conserve moisture in harsh environments. Crepis abietina is often found in open meadows and on slopes where it can thrive in the cool, moist conditions of high altitudes.
